summary.p: 317 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: R. 38; Qurʾānic Text: unclear; 18 lines per page; Dimensions: 145 x 145mm; Script style: kūfī.

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 28f: "86 R. 38. Aynı. Parşömen. 145mm boy ve eninde 317 yaprak. Sahifede kûfi yazı ile 80mm uzunl.[uğunda] 18 satır. Tahminen V- VI (XI - XII) asırda kopya edilmiştir. Y. 1a da İmam Hüsayn in elyazısı oldu[ğu] mukayyettir. Y. 1a, 2a, 2b, 3a da 4 adet müzehhep levha vardır. Serlevha müzehhep, sure başları yaldızlı. Hizip, secde ve aşır işaretleri ve duraklar müzehhep. Miklepli yeşil deri cilt. Bu mushafın Y 90a - 91b ve 94a 95b ye kadar olan kısmı kâğıt üzerine sonradan nesihle yazılmıştır."

This can be translated as follows: "86 R. 38. Same. Parchment. 317 leaves of 145 mm height and width. The text area written in Kufic script [contains] 18 lines measuring 80 mm. Probably copied during the 5th - 6th (11th -12th) century. The handwriting of Imam Husayn is confirmed on page [Leaf] L. 1a. There is an illuminated plate in L. 1a, 2a, 2b, 3a. Gilded serlevha, sūra beginnings, the ḥizb, sajda, and taʿshīr marks. Green leather binding with flap (miklep). The section of this codex from L. 90a to 91b and from 94a to 95b has been later transcribed on paper in naskh script.”
